starting.label: Starting
cbt: You might think 'I can't do this today', but you did it yesterday.
Waiting for perfection is a trap. Start now, perfect later.
Difficulty starting isn't your fault. The ADHD brain just has a sticky start button.
dbt: If you feel heavy, stretch once. Body first, mind follows.
If tense, clench your fists for 5 seconds then release slowly.
Breathe in for 4s, out for 6s. Focus on now.
act: It's okay to be scared. Just turn on the computer.
Accept the thought 'I can't do it', and open one file anyway.
It doesn't have to be perfect. Starting is winning.

working.label: Working/Studying
cbt: If overwhelmed, focus for just 5 minutes.
Multitasking is a myth. One thing at a time is faster.
Don't compare. You have your own pace.
dbt: If distracted, close your eyes and breathe deep 3 times.
If stiff, roll your shoulders 3 times.
If bored, drink water and rest for 5 mins.
act: It's okay to get distracted. Just come back when you notice.
Do the smallest possible thing right now.

stuck.label: Stuck
cbt: If you feel stuck, remember what you've already done.
Being stuck isn't failing. It's pausing.
Instead of 'I'm slow', say 'I'm resting'.
dbt: Open a window for fresh air.
Rotate your wrists to start moving.
Wash your hands with cold water.
act: It's okay to be stuck. Do something else for a bit.
Skip the hard part for now.

emotion.label: Emotions
cbt: Anger is natural. But don't decide while angry.
This too shall pass.
Decide after you calm down.
dbt: Feel your feet on the floor.
act: Anxiety is okay. Work with it.
You don't have to act on your mood.

mistake.label: Mistakes
cbt: Everyone makes mistakes. Next time will be better.
One mistake doesn't define you.
Is it really 100% your fault? Probably not.
Perfectionism is the enemy. Fix it and move on.
Self-blame solves nothing. Fix one small thing instead.
act: Mistakes are okay. Learn from them.
Accept the guilt, then fix what you can.

social.label: Social
cbt: Do they really hate you? Probably just guessing.
Apologize simply if you messed up.
Think of one person who listens.
dbt: Cool your hands before tough talks.
act: Rejection is okay. You only need one person who understands.

motivationMessages: Today is a new start. It doesn't have to be perfect.
You are doing well, even with ADHD.
Don't compare. Go your own speed.
Some days are hard. Start smaller.
antiBrainFogTips: Move your mouse or keyboard immediately.
Open the last file you worked on without thinking.
Write one line of yesterday's work.
Set timer for 10 mins and clean desk.

daySpecificMessages.0: Sunday evening or Monday morning, start slow.
daySpecificMessages.1: Monday blues are okay. Just do one thing.
daySpecificMessages.3: Wednesday, rest if tired. Finish the race.
